title: Viewpoint: 'I feel like I was accidentally hired'
description: Ibrahim Diallo describes what life as a black software engineer has been like for him.

title: Poles in UK fear Brexit and Covid may end 'British Dream' hopes
description: Should I stay or should I go is the top question for many Polish people in the UK, says one charity.

title: Coronavirus: 5G and microchip conspiracies around the world
description: We've been tracking the global spread of two of the most popular coronavirus conspiracy theories.

title: Can Kenzie Ziegler go from child star to pop star?
description: She shot to fame as a six-year-old on US reality show Dance Moms, now she's aiming for the charts.

title: How Facebook scammers target people at risk of suicide
description: Dozens of Facebook pages claim to be selling a deadly chemical to people at risk of suicide - but it's all a fraud.

title: Coronavirus: The health claims that won't go away
description: Why this misleading health advice keeps appearing online.

title: From coronavirus doctor to Mr Gay World
description: Fran Alvarado from Spain took over the title weeks after recovering from Covid-19.

title: Wembley park murders: Emotional interview with mum of sisters found dead
description: The mother of two sisters stabbed to death in a Wembley park spoke to the BBC's Martin Bashir.

title: Fortnite Movie Nite: Christopher Nolan's hit films screen in-game
description: Christopher Nolan's movies play inside Fortnite while his latest film is delayed again.

title: 'Serious' incident shuts down Glasgow city centre
description: There is a heavy police presence on West George Street with more than a dozen police vehicles at the scene.

title: Coronavirus: US hits record high in daily cases
description: More than 40,000 infections recorded in a day as surge prompts some states to halt reopenings.

title: Labour anti-Semitism row: Long-Bailey allies urge Starmer to reinstate her
description: The Labour leader fired his shadow education minister after vowing to get tough on anti-Semitism.

title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says 'history not a burden any more' after title win
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says "history is no burden any more" after leading the club to their first league title in 30 years.

title: Scotland 'not far away' from eliminating coronavirus
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon says there were no deaths from confirmed cases of coronavirus in the past 24 hours.

title: Tate Modern: Jonty Bravery jailed for throwing boy from balcony
description: Jonty Bravery threw a six-year-old boy from a 10th floor viewing platform at London's Tate Modern.

title: Coronavirus: Ministers 'reluctant' to close beaches over crowds
description: Sun-seekers should cooperate and observe distancing rules, Environment Secretary George Eustice says.

title: Coronavirus death rate falling in hospitals
description: Researchers at the University of Oxford identified the pattern in hospital case data for England.

title: Shopping centre giant Intu on brink of administration
description: Intu, the owner of the Trafford, Braehead and Lakeside centres, fails to reach a deal with lenders.

title: Wembley park sisters' murder photo share 'disgusting'
description: Two unnamed officers were suspended after non-official images of the scene were shared.

title: Obamacare: Trump asks Supreme Court to invalidate Affordable Care Act
description: The US president launches a new legal challenge to his predecessor's signature law.

title: Retired midwife's experiences of racism in Yorkshire
description: A retired midwife has spoken out about the racism she faced over five decades in Yorkshire.

title: Rethink: 'There has been a renaissance of love for nature,' says author Lucy Jones
description: Writer and author Lucy Jones considers how - post lockdown - we can capitalise on our rediscovered love of nature.

title: Liverpool FC: Ecstatic fans party on the streets
description: Supporters gather at Anfield and throughout the city to celebrate Liverpool's Premier League win.

title: Summer holidays: 'We're not really going anywhere'
description: People tell the BBC what they plan to do about their holidays this year amid the coronavirus pandemic.
